result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

INITIAL SCHEDULING ORDER

Activity:  Arraingment  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

01:26 PM Defendant Marctonio Deshawn Barnes in court by phone with attorney Murali S. Jasti by video.  David Zarwell appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.    Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.  Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.  Bond continued.
Arraignment on May 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Activity:  Preliminary hearing  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

09:09 AM Defendant Marctonio Deshawn Barnes in court in person with attorney Murali Jasti in person.  Kyle Edward Johnson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Witness has not appeared for the second time.  Motion to dismiss by Attorney Jasti.  Court denies motion to dismiss.  Witness is to appear in person and prelim will start when the witness arrives.  Recalled at 10:20 am with same appearances.  Witness is now in person.  Officer Darryl Thornton sworn and testified in person.  Witness has identified defendant.  Court takes judicial notice of conviction in 2007CF2261 based on stipulation for preliminary hearing only.  State motions for bind over.  Defense objects to bind over with argument and requests motion to dismiss.  Further argument by ADA Johnson.    Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information.    Bond continued.  Arraignment scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Activity:  Adjourned initial appearance  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

09:41 AM Defendant Marctonio Deshawn Barnes in court in person with attorney Larry R Pruden in person.  Kyle Edward Johnson appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. Witness unavailable. Court finds good cause to continue matter.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.
